metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2221 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Open redirect vulnerability in the wp_validate_redirect function in wp-includes/pluggable.php in WordPress before 4.4.2 allows remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via a malformed URL that triggers incorrect hostname parsing, as demonstrated by an https:example.com URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.2+dfsg-1').
